meanings.definition: Remove (someone) from active service in the armed forces due to injury or illness.
meanings.sent1: The soldier was invalided out of the army after being injured in battle.
meanings.sent2: She invalided her brother from the military when he fell ill.
meanings.sent3: The injured soldier was invalided out of the army, but he still had a strong spirit.
meanings.sent4: After the accident, his dreams of being a soldier were invalided, but new dreams took their place.
meanings.sent5: The image of the soldier being invalided out of the army stayed with her, a reminder of sacrifice.

meanings.definition: Declare (something) to be invalid or void.
meanings.sent1: The judge invalided the contract due to a legal technicality.
meanings.sent2: They invalided the old law to make way for a new one.
meanings.sent3: The magician's spell was invalided by a simple wave of the hand.
meanings.sent4: Her doubts about the decision were invalided when she saw the evidence.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of relief when the old rule was invalided was palpable in the room.
